t: A psalm of David. When he fled from his son Absalom.
Lord,*spn how many are my foes! How*ld many rise up against me!
Many*ln are saying of me, “God*ld will not deliver him.”
But*pn you, Lord,*s are a shield around me, my*ld glory, the One who lifts my head high.
I*ln call out to the Lord,*s and*ld he answers me from his holy mountain.
I*pn lie down and sleep; I*ld wake again, because the Lord*s sustains me.
I*ln will not fear though tens of thousands assail*ld me on every side.
Arise,*pn Lord!*s Deliver*ld me, my God! Strike*ln all my enemies on the jaw; break*ld the teeth of the wicked.
From*pn the Lord*s comes deliverance. May*ld your blessing be on your people.
